body.p: The following list summaries the qualified configurations and their purpose.
body.note: While the hardware requirements are similar to those of HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1, this is a completely new installation, not an upgrade or update operation.

ul.li: Single control plane for all control plane services
Single bond of two network interfaces
Network traffic separation providing for different services on different VLANs
Multiple server roles for different services (Compute, Object etc) with different disk configuration options
Scaled down example, optimized for reduced server count
Dedicated deployer node needed
Control Plane with one cluster

Cloud controllers (minimum of 3 nodes for database quorum)
Monitoring/Logging
Neutron network services (centralized routers, DHCP, metadata, default SNAT, VPN agent)
Swift Object
MySQL, RabbitMQ, API, Other Services

Resource pool
Compute (minimum of one node)
VSA Cluster (minimum of one node, no high availability)
6 with VSA (1 deployer, 3 control plane, 1 compute, 1 VSA)
5 without VSA (1 deployer, 3 control plane, 1 compute)
VSA can be 0, 1 or 3 nodes.
Controller
Compute
VSA
A dedicated network for IPMI/iLO must be connected to all the nodes

Dedicated network interface for operating system installation and Ansible
Configured as part of os-deploy, used by Ansible, not further configured by the deployer

One pair of bonded network interfaces
Bond0: Management, External API, External VMs, Vxlan, Provider VLANs
Each network is a single L3 segment
Load-balancers for control plane APIs are provided by haproxy
TLS only on external API, using customer supplied certificate
VLAN IDs and IP addressing provided by customer
See the Minimum Hardware Requirements page for hardware requirements.
